metadata.title: CVE-2017-15906 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
The process_open function in sftp-server.c in OpenSSH before 7.6 does notproperly prevent write operations in readonly mode, which allows attackersto create zero-length files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15906` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.6p1-4
openssh-server - 1:7.6p1-4
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.6p1-4
openssh-tests - 1:7.6p1-4
ssh - 1:7.6p1-4
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.6p1-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:7.6p1-4').
